profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Felix Emmanuel Schelling (1858-1945) was an Elizabethan scholar who was a professor of English literature at the University of Pennsylvania from 1886-1934. He received his bachelor's degree from Penn in 1881 and his LL.B in 1883.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Felix Emmanuel Schelling. Materials include: typescripts, manuscripts, and reprints of his lectures, articles, reviews, and other writings; notes for lectures on Shakespeare; an autobiographical manuscript; clippings, including "The Gownsman" (Schelling's column in the Evening Public Ledger), 1918-1919; music scores; newsletters; and incoming and outgoing correspondence with colleagues, editors, publishers (1875-1944). Correspondents include Horace Howard Furness, Joseph Quincy Adams, Frank Aydelotte, Harrison Smith Morris, and Alfred Edward Newton.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: University of Pennsylvania, Archives and Records Center: Felix Emmanuel Schelling papers (UPT 50 S322).
